Another Artist did a similar story, except it' all wrapped up in a single doujin! Basically it's a Black Cat Lolibaba Maid! And she's ALOT more yandere then our fox girl in this story! Namely because she chose a petite loli form, the guy she loved jilted her because he wanted "Adult Big Breasted Women", so she decided to "punish him" and get what she wants by brainwashing his descendant to mate with her and have a child! Then gaslight and do the same to them till they have a child, as her process means they have a very low lifespan of 30 or so years! Each time being "the maid cat woman who raised them" meaning she never identified herself as their mother to continue her insane fantasy! She acts "stoic and emotionless" till she gets what she wants! Then the "yandere appears!" At least Fox Girl here took note of her mistake...before she "Conveniently forgot" once she got what she wanted at the end (Being Loved, what she forgot was going too far like she did to keep it!)

Options, options. Hope we get another installment to find out.

But that's the "Definition of Insanity". And she's always presented as "VERY INSANE". It's tragic because she seems to "just want to be loved" (and the type to willingly accept abuse if it will let her have her delusion of it). This is realistic in that she actually was learning and regretting what she did, but the guy did the worst possible thing "feeling pity and wanting to help her by giving her the love she deserves in his mind". It made her completely suffer an "Aesop Amnesia" scenario where she got what she always wanted, "a kind hearted man who would love her in mind, body and soul"....just like her first love. In short she forgot every mistake she made that laid her so low and destroy the bloodline of the one she loved, and is going to do the same fuck up all over again. You never give theses type of people a "do-over" option, because then they'll believe "this time" they can make their "mistakes" work and be "success"....when we all know the end result will "be the same".

Simply put it that guy was a human who has a definite life and a destined fate but when he met the Gedou who is a inhuman his fate was changed and now he will live with her for eternity as if immortality is a curse the mote you live, the more painful it becomes

@Iexpectedbetter That's because it is, seems the "Fox Goddess" didn't fade away as shown in the previous story when her final descendant died (from the logical conclusion of all that "inbreeding" she caused trying to push her yandere obsession with her first love onto the male descendants she had with him). The smile at the end along with her words makes me believe "she didn't learn or atone" and is going into "this time I can make it work, I just have to avoid making 'some' of the mistakes I made prior this time!" mindset. Poor guy, if I'm right on what she's thinking, Then he was wrong about her, she "didn't learn her lesson & properly atone", she's just going to make the "same mistakes" all over again from scratch (Like the bad ending of Silent Hill 2 where you pick Marie, as it's shown when they're leaving Silent Hill that's she's "coughing" showing she's going to get sick like Mary and all this mess is going to happen to James all over again, Nothing was gained, nothing was learn)
